DOC.brief_summary: The efficacy and safety of panitumumab (Vectibix) in the routine clinical setting will be studied. Specifically, information will be collected on the following as events of interest: skin disorders, interstitial lung disease, infusion reactions, electrolyte abnormalities, and cardiac disorders.
DOC.brief_title: Panitumumab for Intravenous Infusion 100 mg and 400 mg Special Drug Use Surveillance "Survey on Unresectable, Advanced or Recurrent Colorectal Cancer With Wild-type KRAS Gene" (All-patient Surveillance)
DOC.detailed_description: The efficacy and safety of panitumumab (Vectibix) in the routine clinical setting will be studied. Participants of this surveillance will be patients with unresectable, advanced or recurrent colorectal cancer with the wild-type KRAS gene. The planned sample size is 2,000 patients. The usual adult dosage is 6 mg/kg of panitumumab given by intravenous drip infusion over a 60-minute period once every 2 weeks. The dosage may also be reduced as needed, depending on the patient's condition.
DOC.criteria: Unresectable, advanced or recurrent colorectal cancer with wildtype KRAS gene Patients with a medical history of severe hypersensitivity to any of the ingredients of Vectibix
